title: As It Happened: England's Horror Brisbane Ashes First Session | 10 News
description: A valiant fight back from England on day one at the Gabba after another Mitchell Starc new-ball masterclass. Nathan Lyon was shockingly dropped from the team, with Steve Smith using daylight savings as part of their reasoning. title: Viral Aussie Twin Sisters Campaign To Protect Birds From Construction Proposal | 10 News+
description: Paula and Bridgette Powers, affectionately known as ‘The Twinnies’ online, took the internet by storm earlier this year for their uncanny trait of speaking in exact unison. Now, the viral twin sisters from Queensland are using their fame to campaign against the proposed development of a music festival site on the Sunshine Coast. The construction would impact a green belt where some of the bird species from their sanctuary live. title: Under-16 Social Media Ban To Begin, Spotify Wrapped 2025, New Epstein Island Photos | 10 News+
description: Young Australian influencer Samuel Weidenhofer uses his platform to spread kindness and help others. Using the power of social media, he has raised over $2 million in a bid to help an 88-year-old American man retire from his supermarket job. Ed, who is a veteran who lost his wife and had his pension taken away, will be surprised by Samuel in Detroit with a retirement party on Friday.  As the countdown towards December 10 begins, when Australia’s landmark social media ban will come into effect, children under 16 are already being locked out of their accounts. A message has been appearing on Instagram, Facebook, and Threads, informing users they won’t be able to access the platform and that their profiles won’t be visible, until they turn 16. 10 News+ spoke to Sydney teenager, Noah Jones, who is behind a High Court challenge to stop the government’s new laws. He says predators and explicit content will still exist online and that kids will find ways to bypass the ban, making it more dangerous.  Paula and Bridgette Powers, affectionately known as ‘The Twinnies’ online, took the internet by storm earlier this year for their uncanny trait of speaking in exact unison. Now, the viral twin sisters from Queensland are using their fame to campaign against the proposed development of a music festival site on the Sunshine Coast. The construction would impact a green belt where some of the bird species from their sanctuary live.  United States House Democrats have released photos and videos of late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein’s private Caribbean island. The new vision shows bedrooms, offices, and even a room with a dentist chair. Other photos featuring a blackboard and a landline phone have some names redacted. title: FBI Arrests Man Suspected Of Placing Capitol Riot Pipe Bombs | 10 News
description: The FBI has arrested Brian Cole, Jr, the man accused of planting pipe bombs in Washington D.C. the night before the 2021 January 6 Capitol Riots.  Cole was arrested at his home in Woodbridge, Indiana, after authorities offered a $500,000 reward with the release of more surveillance footage.  The arrest follows years of investigations and searching, with the footage showing a person placing a bomb near a bench outside Democratic National Committee building.  The suspect also placed another bomb outside of the Republican headquarters, both sites are close to the Capitol Building.  Both bombs were discovered the same day Donald Trump supporters stormed congress in an attempt to stop the official transition of power to then-elected President Joe Biden. title: Grand Masters Compete In Diving Chess Championship | 10 News
description: An American has quite literally made a splash after beating his fellow compatriot in an underwater chess event in South Africa.  Hans Niemann emerged as the winner to open the week’s festivities for the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam Finals in Cape Town, where the world’s elite players gathered ahead of the main competition.  Players made their moves on a small chess set placed 110 centimetres deep on the bottom of the hotel's rooftop pool and each time a player came to the surface for some air, the opponent had to dive instantly and make their move. title: Four Countries Boycott Eurovision 2026 After EBU Clears Israel To Compete | 10 News
description: Four European broadcasters from Ireland, Spain, Slovenia and the Netherlands have confirmed they will not compete in Eurovision 2026, boycotting the contest after the EBU declined to hold a vote on whether Israel should compete amid the genocide in Gaza.  Delegates instead backed new rules to limit government or third-party influence on voting, a move critics said failed to address concerns about Israel’s inclusion.  Irish broadcaster RTÉ and Spanish broadcaster RTVE said participation was “unconscionable” and “insufficient”, while Dutch and Slovenian broadcasters also withdrew on values grounds.  The BBC and German broadcaster SWR confirmed they will still take part, with Israel officially cleared to compete in next year’s contest in Vienna.  Russia was banned from Eurovision after its full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022. title: Colombian Navy Seizes 4.5 Tonnes Of Cocaine In The Caribbean | 10 News
description: A staggering 4,500 kilograms of cocaine has been intercepted by the Colombian Navy in the Caribbean, dealing a $216 million blow to drug trafficking organisations.  The seizure occurred approximately 80 nautical miles northwest of the Gulf of Morrosquillo after naval intelligence detected a go-fast speedboat departing for Honduras.  Five suspects were arrested, and 180 bales were confiscated as a result of the operation, with local authorities believing the drugs belonged to the organised armed group Clan del Golfo.
